title: Bug 10403: Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: When a user creates a new project and sets the output folder to an existing bin directory, the bin directory is not scrubbed.
EB: When a user creates a new project and sets the output folder to an existing bin directory, the bin directory should be scrubbed, i.e., deleted and rebuilt.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the project creation dialogue.
2. Choose an existing bin directory as the output folder.
3. Click on the 'Create Project' button.
4. Verify that the bin directory is not deleted and rebuilt.
